cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 110 miles east of Cape Canaveral, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: tracking north, then north-northeast parallel to the southeast U.S. coast toward South and North Carolina before accelerating offshore of the Mid-Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just offshore the South Carolina/North Carolina coast (Cape Fear–Cape Lookout area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North Carolina/Virginia border to Chincoteague VA, including Chesapeake Bay south of Smith Point
weather_observation.warning_coast: None affecting Virginia at this time (warnings confined southward from Florida to Surf City NC)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Southeast and Mid-Atlantic coast from Florida to Virginia
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Possible (2–4 ft inundation possible into lower Chesapeake/VA barrier islands)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (sustained 35–45 kt, gusts 50+ kt) possible Friday as Dorian passes just offshore
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 2–4 ft above ground level possible in tidal sections of the lower Chesapeake Bay and VA barrier islands if the peak surge coincides with high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches of heavy rain with localized higher amounts could trigger flash-flooding in Hampton Roads and coastal VA
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents, minor coastal erosion, and a low tornado risk in outer rainbands
